Class HW2_zfergus2.CohenSutherlandLineClipping

  • java.lang.Object
    • HW2_zfergus2.CohenSutherlandLineClipping
  • Enclosing class:
    HW2_zfergus2

    public static class HW2_zfergus2.CohenSutherlandLineClipping
extends java.lang.Object
    Implementation of the Cohen Sutherland Line Clipping algorithm, algorithm for clipping a line to be inside a clipping area.
    Author:
    Zachary Ferguson

    • Method Detail

      • getOutCode

        public static byte getOutCode(double x,
                              double y,
                              double xmin,
                              double xmax,
                              double ymin,
                              double ymax)
        Computes the out code for the given point. Used to determine position of the point in the Cohen Sutherland Line Clipping algorithm.
        Parameters:
        x - The x position of the point.
        y - The y position of the point.
        xmin - The minimum x position of the clipping area.
        xmax - The maximum x position of the clipping area.
        ymin - The minimum y position of the clipping area.
        ymax - The maximum y position of the clipping area.
        Returns:
        Returns a byte for the out code of the given point.

      • clipLine

        public static double[][] clipLine(double[] v0,
                                  double[] v1,
                                  double xmin,
                                  double xmax,
                                  double ymin,
                                  double ymax)
        Clip the line given the end points and the clipping area, and return this clipped line.
        Parameters:
        v0 - A double[] for the first endpoint's position.
        v1 - A double[] for the second endpoint's position.
        xmin - The minimum x position of the clipping area.
        xmax - The maximum x position of the clipping area.
        ymin - The minimum y position of the clipping area.
        ymax - The maximum y position of the clipping area.
        Returns:
        Returns a double[][] for the clipped line. Returns null if outside the clipping area.
